oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Case Report: An Outbreak of Salmonella newport in a Beef Cow Herd Associated with the Presence of BVD Persistently Infected (BVD-PI) Animals
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Daly, R. F.
Neiger, R. D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Salmonella infections
Immunosuppressive factors
BVD
salmonellosis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Salmonella infections are significant causes of illness in animals and humans. Immunosuppressive factors such as environmental stressors and infectious agents, such as BVD virus, may contribute to the expression of salmonellosis. This report describes an outbreak of salmonellosis in a beef herd associated with the presence of BVD-PI animals.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2007; 237
